scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You expressed understanding of Monica's concerns and acknowledged you should have set clearer boundaries. Bob commented that worrying about setting boundaries is over the top, and you agreed with him, noting that sometimes sacrifices are necessary for the team. [Monica] looks at you with a mix of disbelief and concern.
scenes.description: [Monica] sighs, 'But [Alex], if we keep bending over backwards every time, won't we end up burning out? How do we draw the line?'

options.text: It’s a tough call, Monica. I guess it’s about knowing our limits and communicating them effectively.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the challenge and emphasize the importance of knowing personal limits, showing empathy but lower social skills.

options.text: Maybe we need to have a team discussion about this and set some ground rules.
options.analysis: You suggest a proactive approach to addressing the issue, showing good emotional perception and social skills but moderate motivation.

options.text: Honestly, if we can't handle a few extra tasks, maybe we're in the wrong line of work.
options.analysis: You take a more assertive stance, showing strong motivation but lower empathy and social skills.
